creditline: Gift of James Harris and the Marilyn C. Benson Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: Two columns and five rows of horizontal elements; each element has a wooden core wrapped with a sleeve of black fibers; top of each element has wire bristles attached, with pile placed toward outer edges of installation, with shades of bright copper nearest center and fading to black at outer edges; each element numbered on back
dimension:
5 1/2 × 26 3/4 × 3 in. (14 × 67.9 × 7.6 cm) (object part, approx., each element)
36 × 58 × 3 in. (91.4 × 147.3 × 7.6 cm) (overall)
medium: Iron, copper, brass wire, wood, and fibers
text: Fire Field was the last work of art Mary Giles created. It was commissioned for the exhibition “Designing Women II: Masters, Mavericks, Mavens” held at the Egg Collective showroom in New York City in 2018. It is one of only two large-scale wall-mounted works created throughout her career. The other was the similarly titled “Totem Field,” which she created for the 10th International Triennial of Tapestry, Lodz Poland, now held in a private collection.
title: Fire Field
